strIntroduction: Lake Mashu is famous for being Japan's clearest lake. It is also where a rare natural phenomenon can be seen in the wee morning hours. This tour takes you to the observatory 200m above ground where, if the right conditions prevail, you can see the heavenly sight of the sea of clouds. if not, you will still have an amazing view of Japan's clearest lake. Your guide will explain the story of the sea of clouds of Lake Mashu from Ainu times. This 30-min early morning tour is a great way to start the day!
strTitle: Amazing Sea of Clouds Tour at Lake Mashu Observatory

strIntroduction: Experience the relaxing fun of horse riding on this 90-min tour that will bring you through the beautiful nature of Hakodate Prefecture. Even if you haven't tried horse riding before, don't worry as you will get a 45min training session before heading out for your horseback tour where you will get to see the forests of Mt Komagatake - a fun and easy way to do a nature tour! The horses are all experienced gentle beasts that will ensure a fun and safe ride.
strTitle: 90min Horse Riding in the Hakodate Outback

strIntroduction: If you have tried canoeing a few times, you must try canoeing in the crystal clear waters of Hokkaido's Niseko Shiribetsu River. The joy of gliding down the gentle river, surrounded by lush flora and fauna, with birdsong in the background is something that has to be experienced when in Hokkaido. After a relaxing morning of discovering the nooks and crannies of the river and the local birds and river fish, enjoy a riverside BBQ lunch of lamb called Genghis Khan - a Hokkaido soul food, so called as the hot plate used to cook it resembles a helmet said to have been used by the warlord. A great activity for outdoor-loving family and friends!
strTitle: Full Day Canoe Tour on Niseko's Shiribetsu River+BBQ Lunch

strIntroduction: This is a great way to get a taste of Tokachi and meet the locals!. This farm cooking class allows you to visit a farm and see the ingredients in their natural state before using them in cuisine that brings out the best of their flavors. Your cooking instructors have appeared on TV, and own their own bakery, so you are in good hands. Pick up cooking tips from them and take home recipes to recreate for the folks back home! Enjoy the fun and warm atmosphere on the farm and have fun getting to know the locals over a delicious farm fresh meal!
strTitle: Cooking in Tokachi -See, Cook and Eat the Fields of Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Experience the tranquil beauty of Kushiro's vast wetlands up close, from the Kushiro river that runs through it! During this 2 hr course, the only noise you will hear is the sound of your paddle cutting into the stream's surface and the natural soundtrack of nature-a bird's call, or the rustle of the wind. Lose track of time as you immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the wetlands, and enjoy spotting wildlife such as Japanese red cranes and other birds, like the cormorant or eagles. Take in Kushiro's breathtaking beauty at your own pace on this private chartered canoe tour!
strTitle: Private Chartered Tour of Kushiro Wetlands by Canoe

strIntroduction: This is your chance to learn all about the endangered Japanese red-crowned crane in its natural habitat. Your expert guide will take you through its natural surroundings in the Toro Nature Center and explain the ecosystem and behaviour of the Japanese crane. Depending on the season, you may be able to see baby chicks of the crane. Learn also about the marshland environment and its unique features. This 2hr tour will be a real eye-opener to the life of the Japanese crane and its natural surroundings.
strTitle: 2-hr Japanese red-crowned crane observation tour

strIntroduction: The vast Shiretoko Peninsular is best explored via cruise ship where you can get views of majestic waterfalls and giant rock formations that you cannot get on shore. If you are lucky, you can also see wild dolphin swimming in the azure ocean, bears on the shore or even deer. See cormorants and eagles soar in the sky above as you sit on the open air deck seats. This 1hr course fits easily into your schedule and gives you a highlight of the pristine nature that the Shiretoko Cape has to offer. Not to be missed!
strTitle: 1-hr Shiretoko Peninsula Cruising: Io-zan Course

strIntroduction: One of the best way to explore the Rishiri Islands is of course in the ocean! Beginners can take part in this 1hr kayaking tour as well. Your guide will take you to the main sightseeing spots such as dramatically formed islets and places to see seals and sea lions. Be amazed by the emerald green ocean and pristine beauty of the Rishiri Islands. An easy tour with amazing sights suitable for all.
strTitle: 1hr Sea Kayak Tour at Rishiri Island, Hokkaido. See Seals!

strIntroduction: For those who have tried whitewater rafting before, have you even felt right afterwards that you want to do it again? Well, now with this half-day tour, you can! You get to experience the 2.5km course two times so you can get your fill of all the thrills and spills of the Tokachi River, the second biggest river in Hokkaido. Along the way you can try body rafting, climbing a waterfall, and even picking amethyst! A great bonding activity with a family rafting program available.
strTitle: Half-Day Tokachi River Whitewater Rafting Course!2X the fun!

strIntroduction: Have you hard of body rafting? If not, it's because its only available here at Tokachi. Experience the thrills of having the river surging under you as you raft using a floating tube called an Air Board. This enhances the experience of the river! Unlike usual rafting, the Air Board puts you as close as possible to the currents of the river and lets you feel it and ride it in a sensation unlike anything else! Enjoy nature and have fun in the river this summer with this fun and thrilling activity with the guidance of your experienced instructors.
strTitle: Body Rafting Experience At Tokachi! Only Available Here!

strIntroduction: This is a great tour for friends, families, couples and even sole adventurers. Make the best of your time at night by taking part in this night cruise on the Tokachi River that flows through Obihiro City. In the middle of Obihiro City, in a dark canal, you will be in a canoe with other fellow adventure seekers and romantics, quietly paddling through the river, gazing at stars in the sky, with gentle chirrups of the bugs. After the relaxing cruise with the soothing noises of nature, enjoy some delicious local desserts afterwards! Tokachi is famous for its sweets and pastries throughout Japan! This will be sure to delight the ladies!
strTitle: Tokachi Night River Cruising! Surreal & Tranquil+Desserts!

strIntroduction: Technology meets nature in this 2hr guided segway tour of Tokachi's Millenium Forest, a beautiful landscaped forest that combines forest, garden, farming and art. The segway is a fun and easy way to discover the vast and perfect beauty of the gardens and surrounding mountain ranges. The Millenium Forest, designed by British garden designer Dan Pearson, won the Grand Award and the International Award of the Society of Garden Designers Awards 2012. Your guide will bring you through the deep forests and to the best vantage points to get a view of the Hidaka mountain range. Afterwards, you can enjoy lunch of coffee at the cafe and restaurant on site. A very fun and pleasant way to spend the day in the great outdoors!
strTitle: 2hr Guided Segway Tour of Tokachi's Millenium Forest

strIntroduction: Experience your dream farmstay here at the Yorkshire farm, with its sprawling 10ha grounds that also has a beautiful rose garden, as well as herb and berry garden. Play with the sheep and feed the cute lamb milk as well as sheep shearing. Also learn how to spin yarn, dye wool and make felt craft. Enjoy the beautiful gardens and farm fresh dining at the red brick restaurant. Then relax in the country house for the night for a peaceful and tranquil farmstay in Tokachi.
strTitle: Shepherding Experience & Hokkaido Farmstay At Yorkshire Farm

strIntroduction: Feel as if you are going back to the Jurassic era as you canoe towards "Volcano Island", known as the Wakoto Peninsular, formed by a volcano eruption. The island still has steam coming out of it! This fun and easy canoe tour, where your guide leads you in a separate canoe, will allow you to hop onto the island that juts into the lake, and take a dip in a free hot spring for public. Enjoy the verdant oasis while relaxing in the natural hot spring, before heading back to continue the canoe tour. See fresh greenery in June and beautiful autumn foliage in October.
strTitle: Canoe Tour of Volcano Island on Lake Kussharo. Beginners OK!

strIntroduction: Get into the same boat, or rather, canoe with fellow nature enthusiasts and have fun getting to know each other while enjoying the vast natural beauty and wildlife of Kushiro wetlands with explanations from your guide on this 2hr course covering 9km. Starting from Lake Toro, you will head towards the wetlands and enjoy the changing scenery from from lake to tributary to mainstream along the way. Marvel at the abundant wildlife around you, such as the endangered species of the Japanese crane, and other birds and animals. A relaxing yet amazing way to see the Kushiro wetlands.
strTitle: Kushiro Wetlands and Kushiro River Canoe Group Tour

strIntroduction: The Kushiro Marshland is breathtaking when viewed from an observatory - and your guide will take you to all the vantage points from which to see this amazing natural feature. Up close, the Marshland also has lots to offer with rich wildlife, like Japanese cranes - the only place where it can be sighted - as well as seasonal flowers. Explore all the nooks and crannies that the marsh has to offer at your own pace with the expert instruction of your guide.
strTitle: Private 6-hr Guided Tour of Kushiro Marshland

strIntroduction: The amazing unspoilt beauty of Lake Onnetou and its surrounding dense forests, famous for its spruce trees, is a sensory treat in richness of color - the turquoise waters and lush green forests are said to be the same since primeval times. With the richness in flora and fauna that the forests have to offer, such as bunchberries or mushrooms, depending on the season, the 4hr trek will seem to end in the blink of an eye. Your guide will inform you about the ecosystem and nature found in the pristine forests. Woodpeckers may be sighted if lucky. This is an amazing trek where time seems to stand still in this mystical nature reserve.
strTitle: Private 4hr Ecotour of Pristine Lake Onnetou & Forest

strIntroduction: Discover the fascinating beauty of the night sky at Kushiro's Lake Mashu, Japan's clearest lake. At the 1st observatory of the lake, you will be able to see a panoramic view of the night sky, with explanation from your tour guide. Your guide will also teach you how to take photos of stars at night. Enjoy this amazing star-filled 30min tour!
strTitle: Lake Mashu 30-min Star Gazing Tour With Explanation of Stars

strIntroduction: World Heritage Site Shiretoko is famous for its bear sightings. This 2hr cruise will take you around the dramatic peninsular in search of this wild beasts. Sightings are almost guaranteed, and this is the safest way to see them!Get your camera ready! Other wild nature sightings that you may see include dolphins, deer, eagles, cormorants and more - Shiretoko is abundant with wildlife. Bear sighting from the cruise is the safest way to see these wild beasts, so get your cameras ready to snap away and be amazed at their natural grace and beauty when you see them!
strTitle: 2hr Shiretoko Peninsula Cruising: Bear Watching Course

strIntroduction: What better way to explore the World Heritage Site of the Shiretoko Peninsular than on a cruise? This way you get to see views of great waterfalls and giant rocks not possible otherwise. There is also a chance to come into contact with dolphins and of course seabirds. Enjoy the amazing view of the azure waters from the open deck on a sunny day, and get great vantage points of the peninsular. Quite often you can get a view of bears near the shore - from the safety of your boat you can take as many photos as you like. This 3-hr nature watching cruise is a highly recommended way to discover the wondrous and pristine nature of the Shiretoko peninsular that has won it recognition as a World Heritage Site.
strTitle: 3-hr Nature Watching Cruise around Shiretoko Peninsular

strIntroduction: Love horses or always wanted to try horse riding? The vast expanse of open forest fields in the Okhotsk area is the best place to try horse riding, be if for beginners or experts. No experience is needed to mount these seasoned and friendly horses who will take you on a scenic route on a gentle gait. Even children from 7 years can join the tour. Your friendly guide will have you take photos with your camera along the way. You'll wish the 20-min ride lasted longer!
strTitle: Horseriding Tour in Okhotsk Outback+Free Phototaking Service

strIntroduction: If you like strawberries, this is one activity not to be missed. Come and pick as many strawberries fresh off the farm, then learn how to make jam! Enjoy the freshly made jam and bring home the rest as a souvenir. There's lots else to do on the farm as well, with sheep to play with, and a terrace to sit on and take in the view of Mt Tokachi-dake. Don't forget to leave space to enjoy a tasty farm fresh meal at the restaurant, and buy back from souvenirs like milk and sausages!
strTitle: Pick Summer Strawberries & Make Jam On A Furano Farm!

strIntroduction: This is your chance to try freshly-made sausages - stuffed by your own hands too! Visiting a farm is a must-do while in bucolic Furano, and while you are there, why not pick up a skill or two? Find out how sausages are made the traditional way and enjoy them freshly grilled! Savor these juicy bangers with a great view of Mr Tokachi-dake in the background. Have a relaxing meal with fresh air and farm fresh food on the outdoor terrace of the farm. A memorable activity for the whole family! Don't forget to buy some farm products from the on-site shop!
strTitle: Experience making original Furano pork sausages on a Farm!

strIntroduction: Make your own summer berry jam on this idyllic and spacious Furano farm and enjoy it together with some ice cream also made by yourself! Savor the simple pleasures and tastes of farm living and have a relaxing day on the farm terrace, enjoying the view of the surrounding mountains and rolling fields of Furano. You can also have a delicious farm fresh lunch there and buy for souvenirs at the shop to bring home - along with your home made jam of course! Great fun for the whole family!
strTitle: Berry Jam and Ice Cream Making in Furano! Free Pick-up!

strIntroduction: Let yourself go wild this summer as you fully immerse yourself in the beautiful nature of the Hidaka mountain range with this summer-only activity called Canyoning - where you trek, jump, swim and slide through the forest to your goal! Become Tarzan! You will be provided with a wet suite, life jacket, helmet and wet boots - just don't forget your sense of fun and adventure! The cool embrace of the gentle river, the warm sun rays and beautiful birdsong will make you lose track of time. A great team building activity and fun for outdoor lovers!
strTitle: Summer Exclusive! Canyoning at Hidaka Mountain Range Base!

strIntroduction: Treat your family and friends to the fun of river rafting with this easy and relaxing ride that goes down gentle Soragachigawa River. Enjoy the surrounding beauty of mountains and fields while gliding along the crystal clear river and feel refreshed! Take a splash in the shallow parts of the river and have fun with the kids, and maybe try to spot some river fish. A truly wonderful activity that the whole family can enjoy, just 1 hr from Furano.
strTitle: Easy Rafting Course, Suitable for Kids! Non-swimmers OK!

strIntroduction: Discover the joys of kayaking at Hokkaido, where expert guides will teach you how to handle the sturdy one-man boat that is easily to control. You will be taught the basics and carefully guided along the way, and soon you will be enjoying the natural flow of the river, the refreshing splash of the waters, the sounds of nature and the cool rush of the river breeze. There's no better place to learn kayaking than at the Class A Mukawa River that offers all levels of courses for various degrees of proficiency. You can also book a private lesson to get one-to-one instruction during this 3hr course.
strTitle: Learn How To Kayak in the Class A Mukawa River, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Discover the tranquil joys of fishing with this course where you will be provided with all fishing equipment and expert instruction on how to fish. Soon, you will be concentrating on catching your first river trout, while becoming one with nature as you stand in the cool gentle stream of the Tokachi river. The river is known to produce trophy sized trout, so why not try your beginner's luck? Your guide will help you BBQ your fish for a delicious riverside lunch. Savor the taste of Hokkaido summer!
strTitle: Half Day River Fishing! Catch Rainbow Trout & have a BBQ!

strIntroduction: Come and experience the thrill of white water rafting in one of the most beautiful rivers in Japan, the Mukawa River near Furano. This is a great summer activity to keep cool and enjoy with the whole family and friends! All you need is a sense of fun, and preferably a love for speed, as you hop on a raft and let your guide tackle the Class A Mukawa River, with its tricky drops and turns! Don't worry as there is also a guide on a separate kayak to ensure your safety. Just hang on tight and enjoy the beautiful view going past you. The cooling splash of the clear river water is so refreshing you'll be craving for more! After the excitement, enjoy a relaxing hot spring bath nearby.
strTitle: White Water Rafting on the Class A Mukawa River+Hot Spring!

strIntroduction: The lovely fields of Furano are truly best explored on bicycle. With the lovely scenery passing by you, it is easy to lose track of time. Choose from a half day or full day cycling course to explore the surroundings and discover the wonders of the nature in the forests and meadows. The feeling of freedom and tranquility is a priceless memory that will stay in your memory. You can even extend your stay in the area with free accommodation at a camping site or condominium - just as the tour operator! Great experience for the whole family and friends.
strTitle: Furano Mountain Bike EcoTour:Full/Half Day Plan,Free Stay OK

strIntroduction: Challenge yourself to discover the addictive thrill of bungee jumping this summer and who knows, you may change your perspective on life! Throw out all your worries and take the 20m jump - feel time stand still as you free fall for what seems like an eternity before the tension of your bungee rope kicks in. Then all tension is released and you can laugh and enjoy the swing under the bridge and by the third time you do the jump, you will be enjoying everything moment, and have the capacity to take in the beauty of the natural surroundings as well! This will make for a great summer story to tell the folks back home!
strTitle: 20m Bungee Jump Off The Bridge Near Biei! You Get 3 Tries!

strIntroduction: The idyllic rolling fields of Furano are an ideal cycling course for biking enthusiasts. Now, you don't have to worry about not being able to bring your own bike with this rental mountain bike service that even drops you off at a convenient spot to start your course - be it from a hilltop or a country terrain course. You can also choose to have a picnic lunch packed for you to enjoy on the hilltop - what better way to enjoy the beautiful outdoors of Furano! Enjoy exploring whichever route takes your fancy in an ecologically friendly bicycle tour. Conveniently stop by any spot or shop that catches your fancy and lay in the fields or stop for a tea-break. The hills of Furano aren't steep, so even casual bikers can enjoy the biking tour!
strTitle: Explore Fields of Furano on Rental Mountain Bike!Free & Easy

strIntroduction: What better way to take in the sights of the majestic Taisetsuzan mountain range and national park than by immersing yourself in a nearby river that offers a close up view of the peaks? Feel at one with nature and enjoy the cold clear waters of the river that comes from melted snow from the surrounding mountains. Relish the thrills and spills of white water rafting with the expert steering of your guide, and have fun splashing about with your friends and family! This is a fun summer activity for the whole family! Photos will be taken of your ride which you can purchase later. A free tea break will be provided in between.
strTitle: Go Chubetsu River Rafting! Kids OK! Near Asahikawa Airport!

strIntroduction: Choose from the different faces of Lake Onuma with the morning tour or evening canoeing tour. In the morning, you can canoe amidst the morning mist and gentle sunrays, and in the evening you can take in the stunning view of the sunset, a romantic time of the day. This canoeing tour is suitable for beginners and seasoned canoeists alike, as the stable and sturdy Canadian canoe is used. Your guide will tell you about the seasonal highlights around the lake, and prepare a teatime break for you to enjoy while in the beauty of the lake. Refresh your senses at this tranquil lake, and feel the stress of urban living melting away.
strTitle: Canadian Canoeing in Lake Onuma near Hakodate. Beginners OK!

strIntroduction: Experience a relaxing day on an idyllic farm located atop a hill with a view of Mt Yotei, Hokkaido's Mt Fuji and Lake Toya, making butter and soft serve ice cream from fresh milk! The taste of fresh butter and ice cream made by yourself will be one to relish! You can try making this at home too! After churning fresh milk into butter, reward yourself with a delicious farm fresh lunch on the farm and take in the picturesque scenery. Definitely a great activity for the whole family!
strTitle: Ice Cream & Butter Making Experience on a Hokkaido Farm

strIntroduction: River fun is a summer must-do in Japan and river rafting is by far one of the most popular activities. Be it your first time or if you are a seasoned rafter, you can enjoy this tour that rides the rapids of Niseko's Shiribetsu River, roaring with melted ice water from the surrounding snowy mountains. Enjoy the thrills and spills of river rafting that is fun and safe for the whole family with an experienced guide manning your raft. You will have time to stop by and have fun splashing around the river, and for many photo opportunities of you in the raft! Don't miss this great way to have some cool fun this summer!
strTitle: Most Popular Activity: Rafting on Niseko's Shiribetsu River!

strIntroduction: The lush and beautiful nature of Niseko and the cool climate in its mountain area makes it perfect for a refreshing summer canyoning outing. Canyoning refers to trekking, climbing, abseiling and swimming - in this case, you will use a mat to slide down gentle waterfalls! The trek is just 1 km but an interesting course for beginners and seasoned canyoners alike. Come and throw yourself into nature's embrace with this great summer activity! Don't worry as all required moves will be taught and practiced at the Niseko Outdoor Center first! Enjoy a refreshing hot spring bath after! (optional)
strTitle: Summer Canyoning in the Niseko Mountains+ Onsen Dip!

strIntroduction: If you haven't tried fly fishing before, or are curious about what's so fun about fly fishing, wonder no more. There's no better place to discover the joys of fly fishing than at the amazingly clear waters of Niseko's Shiribetsu River! Your guide will teach you the tricks of fly fishing, and you'll be having fun in no time. Enjoy the tranquility of being immersed in the beautiful natural surroundings with birdsong in the background. Once you give this a try, you're sure to be back for more!
strTitle: Fly Fishing for Beginners at Niseko's Shiribetsu River

strIntroduction: Fishing and catching river fish with one's bare hands is a favorite summer activity in Japan. Experience the fun of wading in the cool and exceptionally clear waters of Niseko River and learn how to catch fish! Then grill them for a delicious lunch! Nothing beats the taste of fish caught by your bare hands! At Niseko, you can also see Mt Yotei, or the Mt Fuji of Hokkaido, and enjoy a dip in a hot spring onsen. You can also choose to stay in a former Japanese school. The traditional wooden building is 80 year old. A fun experience to have with your friends or family!
strTitle: Fishing & Fish Catching at Niseko River+grilled fish lunch!

strIntroduction: Niseko in Hokkaido is famous as a skiing resort, but did you know it also has a lot to offer during summer and autumn? Discover the natural beauty of Niseko's highland marshes with an expert local guide from the Niseko Outdoor Center who will tell you about the natural flora and fauna found in this pristine Shinsen-numa Marsh. This is an easy walking trail that the whole family can enjoy. A great way to refresh your mind and soul by immersing yourself in the vast fields and embrace of Mother Nature!
strTitle: Nature Trek of Shinsen-numa Marsh of Niseko, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: This is a great activity for friends and family to bond, and also to get in touch with the great outdoors! First, have fun learning how to make a raft that will be sturdy enough to take you down the Shiribetsu River, then enjoy the thrill of riding it down the river! You will be amazed how some tire tubes, wood and bamboo will be sturdy enough to take you down the river and give you the chance to be closer to the cool water surface. Have fun splashing your friend and at the end of the ride, hop into a nearby hot spring for a refreshing dip and look back on the wonderful memory and sense of achievement! There is also the option of having lunch and an overnight stay in the surrounding area for more nature rambling!
strTitle: Make Your Own Raft and Ride It Down Shiribetsu River!

strIntroduction: Experience the fun of hunting for and plucking Spring mountain vegetables in the Niseko wilderness, with the help of your expert local guides. Spring vegetables are much loved by the locals for the fresh, slightly bitter taste. These are best enjoyed as a tempura fry up or BBQ, both of which you can try on this tour. Savor the difference in taste of freshly picked vegetables such as bamboo sprouts, Ainu leek, mushrooms and more, depending on the season! Do all this is the wonderful beauty of NIseko's nature, in view of Mt Yotei, Hokkaido's Mt Fuji. If you would like more time to explore the surrounding mountains in a trek, you can choose to stay overnight at an old Japanese school and continue your nature adventure the next day.
strTitle: Pick Wild Plants in Niseko, Make a Tempura or BBQ Lunch

strIntroduction: Flying in the front seat of a glider, 500m high in the clear blue sky, looking down at the colorful fields and terrain of Hokkaido is definitely a top of the world feeling! Unlike airplanes or helicopters, a glider is released by a light plane and soars you high into the sky, with no sound of the engine, it's a surreal peaceful flight, with just you in the front seat, looking at the amazing nature below, the sound of the wind and your pilot seating behind you. The feeling of freedom and free flight is indescribable. Treat yourself to this flying experience just 50min from Sapporo by train!
strTitle: Get High with this Glider Experience! Just Sit Back & Relax!

strIntroduction: If you are an avid diver, the Shakotan Peninsular will definitely be on your bucket list, as this Hokkaido Heritage Site is famous for its glowing turquoise waters and variety of fish and corals underwater. And even if you can't swim or dive, this is the best place to experience your first time - with the blue waters and caves you'll soon lose track of time and the fact that you can't dive or swim! An experienced instructor will be with you at all times so there's nothing to worry about. After the amazing 30-min diving tour and lots of photos of yourself and your group, you can treat yourself to a meal of delicious local seafood such as sea urchin and a dip in a famous hot spring in the area. This is definitely a day trip worth making time for!
strTitle: Diving Tour at Shakotan's Blue Waters & Turquoise Cave

strIntroduction: https://youtu.be/5HpiKRseCMc The Shakotan Peninsular is blessed with turquoise waters in its surrounding oceans. Come and have an unforgettable experience immersing yourself in this surreal natural beauty of azure waters and a bright blue cave. Photos of this magical experience will be taken with an underwater camera and given to you free in a CD. Even non-swimmers can take part with a life-jacket and the accompaniment of the guide with a safe floating board to hold on to. The mystical glow of the waters and cave is a sight that needs to be seen to be believed! So don't miss this experience of a lifetime! Round off the amazing day out with a relaxing dip in a hot spring and enjoy the delicious seafood found around the area!
strTitle: Easy Snorkeling in Shakotan's Turquoise Waters & Blue Cave!

strIntroduction: What better way to spend a summer or autumn afternoon than outdoors - and baking outdoors for that matter! Savor the taste of freshly stone oven baked naan (indian flat bread) made using locally grown and milled flour, "kitahonami", and kneaded by yourself, and you'll be amazed how delicious naan can taste on its own! But that's not all, you will get to pluck as many fresh vegetables grown on the farm, and then salt cast them before baking them for a healthy and tasty meal. There will be a tasty curry sauce provided to complete the meal. The stone oven was built by Mr Sato, the owner of Friendly Farm. Experience healthy and tasty farm living in this friendly environment and enjoy slow food and slow life!
strTitle: Try Stone Oven Outdoor Baking on a Farm! Make Naan & More!

strIntroduction: Let your creative juices flow at this glassware workshop in a traditional brick house, with the one-to-one instruction from an experienced glassware artists who trained in Venice, Italy and has taught in the US, Sweden and Italy. From a glass vase, bowl or cup, the possibilities are endless and the satisfaction of making your own artistic creation cannot be put in words! Just a short train ride from Sapporo city, this rare traditional craft experience is one not to be missed, and suitable for beginners to experts, and children from ages 8 and up.
strTitle: Try glass blowing at historical brick house in Sapporo

strIntroduction: This is a great family activity not to be missed on the way to or from the Shin Chitose airport. With a pick up at JR Chitose station, it's really convenient to get to and fit into your sightseeing schedule! Immersing yourself in the great outdoors is the best way to enjoy summer and autumn in Hokkaido, so treat your family to this easy rafting ecotour that will be edutainment for the whole family! Spot radiant blue kingfishers, river fish such as trout as you glide gently down the stream. Your guide will let you get off the raft and dip into the cool river waters if you can't resist jumping in! One of the most beautiful rivers in Hokkaido is just a short ride away from the airport, so what are you waiting for?
strTitle: Fun Rafting Ecotour on the Chitosegawa River! Ages 3 and up

strIntroduction: https://youtu.be/UmjvoEY-4SM This is a perfect activity for the summer and autumn! Take an easy diving tour at Lake Shikotsu, famous for the quality of its clear waters. Advanced swimming technique isn't needed, and you will be accompanied by a guide so first timers can safely participate as well. You will practice in a shallow area of the lake before going deeper when you are ready. Just breathe using your diving kit and be amazed at the clearness of the underwater world of the caldera lake. Photos of your underwater diving trip will be taken and provided to you free of charge at the end of the 30-min dive, so you don't have to worry about taking photos of the magical experience. Interact with the friendly fish and shrimp that will come up close to you, such as the three-spined stickleback, rainbow trout, goby fish and more! If you reach out your hand, the cute little Lake Prawns will come and rest on your palm - what a great photo to show your friends and family! After the dive, refresh yourself in a 100-year-old hot spring at Marukoma Onsen!
strTitle: Diving Tour of Crystal Clear Lake Shikotsu + Hot Spring Dip

strIntroduction: Lake Shikotsu is famous for its clear waters that make it almost mystical, and for the big trout that swim in its clear waters. Come and discover the magical beauty of this caldera lake in the Shikotsu-Toya National Park, while experiencing the simple joys of fishing. Even if you haven't tried fishing before, your experienced guide will teach you the tricks of trout fishing and you will not leave the session empty handed! Try trout fishing once at Lake Shikotsu, and you'll be hooked!
strTitle: Trout Fishing in Lake Shikotsu, A Mystical Lake in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Enjoy Hokkaido summer and autumn to the fullest by going on a trek! Mt Moiwa, not far from central Sapporo, offers a stunning view of the city as well as over 400 species of flora and fauna, making for a pleasant trekking course. Standing 531m high, Mt Moiwa boasts a number of ancient giant trees ranging from 300 to 500 years old. Come and feel the magical beauty of the virgin forest, and delight in the sights and sounds of birds and other animals inhabiting the forest. Your experienced guide will help you enjoy the wonders of the forest and ensure a safe trek up and down the hill. A taxi transfer service to and from your hotel can be arranged.
strTitle: Half Day Guided Trekking Tour of Mt. Moiwa, With Taxi Option

strIntroduction: Have you always been fascinated by the world of Geisha? Geisha literally means a person who entertains with an art. Enjoy an exclusive performance at a private Japanese residence that will allow you to enjoy a personal encounter with the Geisha. You will be served a luxurious full course traditional Japanese dinner accompanied by fine Japanese sake at this private residential home, reserved specially for your private Geisha dinner party. Be entertained by the skillful performing arts of the graceful geisha, such as classical Japanese dance and music, as well as drinking games for a spot of casual fun. This is a special plan specially arranged for foreign guests, and a great way to impress guests coming to Japan or friends with an unforgettable experience.
strTitle: Geisha Dinner Party in a Private-Home Restaurant, With Taxi

strIntroduction: Do you know that Sapporo's night view from Mt Moiwa, 531 m high, was voted one of Japan's Top 3 last year? Enjoy the stunning scenery from Mt Moiwa and Asahiyama Memorial Park, 137m high, in one night with this easy breezy taxi tour. This is an ideal plan for a romantic date before or after dinner, or for popping the big question! Mt Moiwa is known for being a "Lover's Sanctuary" where you can proclaim your undying love with a lovelock and ring the "Happiness Bell" at the top of the platform. Get picked up from your hotel in central Sapporo for a memorable night of breathtaking scenery. A glass window rope-way will take you halfway up the mountain, from there, you can ride the "Morris Car" (the world's first drive-type cable car) to the top. Make the most of your Sapporo night with this tour!
strTitle: Enjoy the City Lights of Sapporo, With Taxi Pick-Up Service

strIntroduction: Summer and autumn season is the best time to enjoy the lush greenery of nature with outdoor activities such as canoeing! Now, even if you haven't canoed or touched an oar before, the Canadian canoe used in this tour is extremely stable, and the gentle currents of the Jozankei river means that you can glide along this river while enjoying the sights, sounds and breeze with a few easy paddles. Even children from three years of age can safely sit in the boat and enjoy the relaxing river ride. Be it the fresh greenery of summer to the crimson red leaves of autumn, the forests around the Jozankei gorge are a breathtaking sight. So don't miss this chance to enjoy the great outdoors with this unforgettable experience!
strTitle: Easy Canoe Touring in Jozankei,Sapporos Famous Onsen Resort

strIntroduction: If you love sweet and juicy fruits, this is one activity not to be missed! At the Sapporo Fruits Theme Park you can enjoy all-you-can-eat fruits freshly picked by yourself! This beautiful farm sprawling over 41 hectares offers strawberries in spring, cherries in summer, grapes, plums, prunes and more during autumn! Due to its high elevation at 400m above sea level, the distinct difference in temperatures between day and night make for sweet and juicy fruits. Enjoy the natural beauty and sweetness of Mother Nature in the fruit field itself, picking the fruits of your choice and enjoying them freshly picked, while enjoying the fresh air and clear blue sky. After you have had your fill of fruits, you can try other activities such as playing the the Jozankei Farm's pony, try your hand at fishing, making jam or roasting a pizza in a stone oven. Enjoy the simple pleasures of farm life before heading to the airport just 50 minutes away!
strTitle: Fruit Picking at the Sapporo Fruits Theme Park, With Taxi

strIntroduction: Mention Hokkaido and delicious dairy products such as rich, creamy milk, fresh natural cheese and rich, soft serve ice cream comes to mind. Come and try all these delicious dairy products farm fresh at Murakami Farm, a traditional farm which has over 130 cows and has been around for over 100 years. Here, you can try your hand at milking a cow, as well as making butter and feeding a cute calf! You can also sample "Non-Homogenized MIlk", a fresh taste only available on the farm! Savor the difference in freshness and taste, and buy some dairy products home as souvenirs. Of course, the soft serve ice cream is a must try! The farm is conveniently located between Shin Chitose Airport and Sapporo City, a perfect stop for half a day of farm fun right upon arrival or before you leave Sapporo City.
strTitle: Milk Cows & Make Butter on Hokkaido Dairy Farm+Taxi Service

strIntroduction: One can't visit Hokkaido, Japan's largest prefecture in the north, and not visit a farm. Blessed with nature's bounty, Hokkaido is famous for its farm produce, such as corn, potatoes, asparagus and buckwheat as well! On Friendly Farm, you can enjoy the rustic beauty of Hokkaido just 50 minutes by car from Sapporo City, and with taxi transport provided, there's no worry even if you aren't on a driving holiday. Once at the farm, you will be given a chance to make your own buckwheat noodles, or soba, and enjoy the fragrance of freshly made noodles with hot and crispy tempura, a Japanese fry up of seasonal ingredients. After this delightful farm style lunch, you will get a rare chance to try making mochi, or rice cakes, the traditional way using mortar and mullet. Nothing beats the chewy texture of freshly-made mochi, an event which is usually saved for the New Year or auspicious occasions. Mochi making is a rhythmic workout that is perfect to prepare yourself for dessert after lunch. Enjoy the fresh rice cakes with sweet bean baste or roaster soybean flour. The farmers will prepare the mochi in various ways for you to enjoy, including "zoni" which is mochi in a savory soup, a traditional New Year's Day dish. And if there's any food leftover, you can bring it back as a souvenir or snack on the plane!
strTitle: Hokkaido Farm Cooking: Make Buckwheat Soba & Rice Cakes

strIntroduction: The best way to enjoy Hokkaido's glorious nature and wildlife is to immerse yourself in it. If you like the tranquility that flowing rivers and streams brings, try enjoying the river while on an easy-to-balance Canadian Canoe. Even children from 3-years of age can sit safely in one. Almost effortlessly canoe down the glorious Bibi River that takes you through the Yufutsu-genya Plain, while enjoying the birdsong from the surrounding wetlands which is home to over 270 bird species. The final destination is the Utonai-ko Lake, which is located between Sapporo and Tomakomai, 8km from the Pacific coast and in the northwest edge of Yufutsu-genya Plain. The lake is known to be crystal clear, as it is shallow - the deepest point of 120cm and the average depth of 60cm. The lake's perimeter is 9km with an area of 275ha. You'll find it hard to imagine that such surreal beauty is just 10 minutes' by car from the Shin Chitose Airport!
strTitle: Easy Canoe Tour on Chitoses Bibi River with Taxi Pick-Up

strIntroduction: Create your own original Japanese Hanko seal with your original design. Hanko is a good luck charm commonly used: for souvenir for gift for signature for sealing stamp We will create your name in kanji or katakana. Every kanji character has a meaning. Making your kanji name means adding a meaning to your name. You can choose from cool and sharp kanji characters with their meaning that we carefully selected from 50000 characters. Content of the experience: 1. About Hanko - explanation 2. Choose the stamp material 3. Let's make the stamp face 4. Let's press * The contents are subject to change The limit per day is set to 2 people. Time between: 10:00 to 18:00 Very close to Kamakura Station (the exact address will be provided after you book)
strTitle: Enjoy handmade Hanko seal experience in Kamakura!

strIntroduction: Daily cruise, weekdays (Monday to Friday) Day sail Yokohama / Tokyo Bay Cruise Sailing schedule: 3 hours from 11:00 AM to 1.00-1:30 PM (Includes complimentary drinks & snacks) 11:00 AM Board Yokohama Cruising Club Welcoming and Safety introduction: 10 minutes. Depart Yokohama bay via Yokohama bay bridge, sail Tokyo bay in a Southerly direction for 1 hour while relaxing and taking in the views. Return sail to Yokohama Bay 1 hour. Cruise around Yokohama bay waterfront taking in the views of: Yamashita Park, Passenger Ocean Terminal, Cosmo Clock. 1:00-1:30 PM Arrive at Yokohama Cruising Club, complimentary farewell drink included at club house. Lunch is for the cost of the guest. Evening Yokohama Bay Cruise Sailing schedule: 1.5 hours from 7:30 PM to 9.00-09:30 PM (includes complementary drinks and snacks) 7:30 PM Arrive at Yokohama Cruising Club Welcoming and Safety introduction: 10 minutes Cruise around Yokohama bay waterfront taking in the views of: Yamashita Park, Passenger Ocean Terminal, Red Brick building and Cosmo Clock. 9:00-09:30 PM Arrive at Yokohama Cruising Club, complimentary farewell drink included at club house. Dinner is for the cost of the guest. Weekend/public holiday sailing (Please inquire for escape adventure events schedule) WHAT TO BRING: Shoes: The boats deck paint is very sensitive to damage by stones lodged in shoe soles, and request that you bring soft rubber sole type shoes. Clothes & Sun cream: It is always cooler on water than on land, wind breaker and sun cream/ sunglasses are suggested. For some sunglasses are a really cool accessory so bring them. Drinks, snacks and lunch: Complimentary snacks, water, Juice, coffee, beer and house wine is included in the club price. If you like you are also free to bring your favorite bottle of wine and/or beverages. Note: We can arrange for your favorite drinks and food to be on the boat ready waiting for you. If required, this service will be at cost and must be arranged in advance. BOOKING: Kindly note: We can take bookings for up to a maximum of 16 people. Looking forward to enjoying these cruising events with you!
strTitle: Sail on a Yacht Cruise around Yokohama & Tokyo Bay

strIntroduction: We will meet at JR Shimada Station. We will walk to the departing point of the parade. You can enjoy watching traditional Japanese dances. The parade stops to perform dances in Obi-dori Street, the square outside JR Shimada Station and various other locations. If you spot interesting places to visit, we can return there after the parade. We will follow the parade proceeding to Oi-jinja Shrine. At the shrine another dance is performed, dedicated to the Ubusuna deity. Enjoy the atmosphere of the old shrine. After a short break the parade resumes on to Uda-ji Temple. Dances are performed at the temple in honor of Tora Gozen and the Buddha and a thanksgiving ceremony is held in the main temple hall where a variety of Japanese-style hairpieces are on display. During the parade and dances you can take pictures of beautiful Japanese girls and ladies with topknots and yukata. You will see various kinds of topknots. Afterwards you can rest at a cafe, and enjoy shopping along the main street of Shimada.
strTitle: See the Shimada Mage (Topknot) Festival in Shizuoka (Sep 17)

strIntroduction: Oyama Shrine was dedicated to Lord Toshiie Maeda, the first lord of the Kaga Clan. It was built in 1599. Its gate, now specified as a cultural asset, was designed by a Dutch architect named Holtman and built by Yoshinosuke Tsuda. Schedule (Saturday, Sunday) 8:30 Meet at the Kanazawa Station 9:00 Visit Oyama Shrine 9:15 Visit the garden in the shrine 9:30 Have a coffee at Blanket caf 10:00 Break up at the caf Schedule (Monday-Friday) 8:00 Meet at the Kanazawa Station. 8:30 Visit Oyama Shrine 8:45 Visit the garden in the shrine 9:00 Have a coffee at Higashide Coffee 9:30 Break up at the caf I go to work at 9:45 on weekdays I will arrange the schedule depending on your schedule. Please feel free to ask me. The price is per person and includes - guide fee
strTitle: Discover Kanazawa's Oyama Shrine on a Morning Coffee Tour

strIntroduction: We will pick you up at Kanaya Station of Tokaido line, or at your hotel near the station. You can enjoy the drive on the way to the theme park. This is generally a factory tour of Greenpia Makinohara tea factory facility. The first floor is a houjicha factory filled with the aroma of roasted tea. The second floor has Makinohara history room and a refined tea factory where the tea products are finished. On the third floor you can observe the packaging factory where the tea products are put in bags, and the multilevel automated cool storage where the teas are kept - you can see that from a special pathway. Challenge yourself by picking green tea leaves in the tea plantation! In the tea field you can touch tea leaves and pick them, and enjoy the smell of green tea. Upon your request you can wear traditional costumes for tea picking. You can taste specialty foods made with green tea at Maruobara Restaurant. The building was originally a farmhouse of farmers who first cultivated the land of Makinohara and has a history of 140 years. Enjoy dishes such as green tea tempura in the atmosphere of a 140-year history farmhouse. Enjoy shopping at the direct store Ippinkan. In the spacious shops you will be able to find various items, such as particular refreshment tea, black tea, healthy food, and tea utensils, local farm products and gifts.
strTitle: Discover the Green Tea Wonderland at Greenpia Makinohara

strIntroduction: Some people visit temples just for the pictures, but have you ever wondered if theres something else you might be missing? For this trip, well take a quick drive to Honkji temple, and spend a few hours getting to know temple life and the people there. What are the customs to visiting a temple? What does it take to be a monk? What goes on behind the scenes in a temple? From daily life to cultural how tos, Bit and his family are here to guide you and answer any and all of your questions. Plus, there are plenty of chances to snap and share photos of you at the temple, both inside and out. To start, meet us at 10:00 a.m. in front of Hachiko statue at Shibuya station. Then well head over by train and let Bito lead the day from there. Each group is limited to 8 people to ensure everyone has a chance to interact directly with Bito and the activities. There will also be a interpreter so that you dont miss a beat! After the trip, will head back to Harajuku Station, leaving you with an insiders view of temples that you can take across Japan.
strTitle: Ask a Monk! The Expert Temple Guide, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Bento is getting more popular all over the world, and the word "bento" itself is becoming universal. Bento doesnt mean mere lunch box. Its the art of food and nutrition. Youll learn how quickly and easily you can cook it and how beautifully the meal is presented into a box. You shouldnt miss this fun and tasty opportunity! Bento Class: 120 min 1. Introduction: 15 min 2. Cooking Time: 85 min 3. Packing Time: 20 min
strTitle: Experience making Bento (lunch box) in Kyoto

strIntroduction: It is pretty popular for Japanese family to have sushi at home. There are many kinds of sashimi (fish), and more. You might know that there are wide varieties for sushi ingredients, but we will prepare typical seafood, avocado, eggs, and seaweed this time. While having the dinner, why don't we have some green tea which is also typical and a good match for sushi. Let's enjoy a sushi dinner at newly renovate house! Not only you'll be able to have dinner with locals, but this will be a fantastic opportunity to come into a new house which renovation was done in June this year. I would love to show the new house in details. Think of it as a short home-stay program for those who don't have enough time but still want the experience. If you are interested, this can be a meaningful cultural exchange and/or practice of your Japanese language skills. You are welcome to stay longer to have another cup of tea and chat after the meal. It's up to your schedule.   Dinner
strTitle: Hand Roll Sushi party at a new house in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Harajuku is a colorful and crazy neighbourhood that has been creating its own original culture by engulfing the world's trendiest fashions and cultures. It is like a monster that swallows everything in its path and keeps expanding. The Kawaii Monster Cafe is a reflection of this monster visualising Tokyo, Harajuku. First of all, I will pick you up at your accommodation or we will meet up somewhere you like. Then we will go around Harajuku. Even though it's a popular area, I will show you places that tourists don't know and just pass. After that we will go to Kawaii Monster Cafe and enjoy foods and drinks and talking pictures with them. Finally we will go shopping around Harajuku. If you have any requests or questions, please don't heisitate to ask. I look forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Enjoy the amazing Kawaii Monster Cafe and a tour in Harajuku

strIntroduction: This tour is a special spotlight on the origins of tags and graffiti with a local focus on Tokyo. We offer a group price where the participant can reserve to be part of a small expedition of max 5 persons or choose our Private option where up to 2 persons can benefit from the photographer's time in a private setting. Also, this tour option provides a set of 5 edited photos of the participants within 72 hours following the tour! THE TOUR: We'll begin our 2 hour mission of urban discovery by meeting up at Meiji-Jingumae (Harajuku) Station, easily accessible by the Fukutoshin or Chiyoda line. After a 15-20 introduction on general photography, we'll set out on our adventure! Let's fly through some key Harajuku spots and creatively photograph and document the stickers, tags and random works of art we find hidden away or in plain sight to see! Your guide will share insight on the origins of particular street artists and creative ways to photograph mundane urban elements. Now for round two: Shibuya! The infamously streets of Shibuya are home to some of the world's most unique, hidden areas and of course: urban art! We will fly through this neighbourhood armed with our cameras and set our sights on capturing all types of urban scrawls. Your specialist guide will be able to explain certain graffiti styles and methods in this one-of-a-kind street photography tour. Since this tour is FULL of information, we'll take a moment at the the adventure's end to recap and perhaps revisit some of the information that was exchanged. We'll end the tour in Shinjuku, a perfect place for you to unwind after a productive run around town. With it's many restaurants, bars and shops: there'll be no shortage of things to do!
strTitle: Discover hidden streets on a Tokyo Graffiti Photo Tour

strIntroduction: Tokyos cocktail scene is like no other and focuses on craftsmanship, the ingredients and integrity of the flavors themselves. The bartenders take their work very seriously and have an artful approach to their craft. This tour is an experience like no other in the world. It's a must if you enjoy making cocktails or simply like drinking them! This tour features four carefully chosen tasting locations that highlight the best cocktails the city has to offer, made by award winning mixologists. One delicious and well-balanced cocktail is included at each bar. Activity details: Let's meet at Nihonbashi station for 7h30pm, the perfect time to begin a cocktail tour! Over the course of the next 3-4 hours, we will hop from place to place in search of Tokyo's finest cocktails and drinks! We will begin in Nihonbashi and visit one cocktail house. We will then take a quick subway ride to Ginza and spend about 1.5 hours to visit 2 award winning locations that will have your taste buds singing, walking between stops. You'll be able to receive insight on local culture and discuss the Japanese cocktail culture while we stroll from place to place. Then, onward to our next neighbourhood: Ebisu! With the help of the Tokyo Metro, we will speed to our next location; all three neighborhood have a different vibe and atmosphere. Perfect to give you a good overview of Tokyo's cocktail scene. We'll conclude our cocktail tour at this final destination where you'll be free to continue your evening, should you choose to! However, should you be ready to return home, we'll gladly escort you back to the nearest metro station.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo's Amazing Cocktail Tour!

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. In addition, in Inakadate you can tour rice paddy art that uses the land as a canvas and has become famous worldwide. There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. After strolling around Hirosaki Park, sit down with a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). The final leg of the tour takes you to a market very popular with the locals that sells foods unique to the area and miscellaneous goods at reasonable prices. Have fun communicating with the women of the market! At night, stay at Ishiba Ryokan, a traditional Japanese inn that is also popluar with foreigners, and enjoy warm hospitality and a traditional Japanese building designated a registered tangible cultural property. This 2-day tour lets you experience an abundance of the enchantment of both Aomori's past and present! Schedule: Day 1 9:00 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:20 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:00 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:30 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 12:00 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 13:30 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 14:45 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 15:30 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 16:15 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop 17:00 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; walk over to Ishiba Ryokan 17:15 Check-in to Ishiba Ryokan; enjoy the inn experience at your leisure until checkout Day 2 Check-out
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Tsugaru, Aomori: Enchantments of Hirosaki

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. At the Zenringai district, which has a strong historical relationship with Hirosaki Castle, you can also experience Zen meditation. Your spirit will be refreshed. After eating the popular local ramen, sit down with a cup of coffee at an unusual Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). This tour lets you fully experience the enchantment of both Aomori's past and present! The tour ends at an early hour so that afterwards you can readily travel to Oirase Keiryu (mountain stream).Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Hirosaki Apple Park in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 10:15 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 11:00 Experience Zen meditation at Zenringai, where there are 33 temples, all of the Soto school of Zen 12:00 Eat lunch at a local popular ramen shop, Niboshi Chuka 12:40 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 13:20 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour 13:26 Depart from main entrance to Hirosaki Station; take a bus to Aomori Airport (out-of-pocket cost of 1000 yen per person) 14:20 Arrive at Aomori Airport 15:00 Depart on free shuttle bus to Oirase Keiryu 16:30 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Tsugaru, Aomori: Hirosaki's past and present

strIntroduction: The Aizu 33 Kannon pilgrimage has been designated a Japanese Heritage. Among the many temples, it is said that visiting the popular Aizu Korori San Kannon (three temples in Aizu that enshrine the Kannon Goddess of Mercy) will bring blessings. A reserved vehicle is used so you can depart when you like and make efficient use of time, and a volunteer guide will accompany you for a stress-free tour. After enjoying sightseeing, visit Aizu Higashiyama Onsen that has been loved by locals for 1300 years. You can enjoy delicious food at a hot spring inn and soothe away fatigue from your travels in the bath. Schedule: Day 1 13:00 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; visit the Buddhist city of Aizu and Aizu Korori San Kannon (Nakata Kannon, Tachiki Kannon, and Torioi Kannon) 16:30 Check-in to the hot springs inn, Harataki; freely relax and enjoy the hot springs baths and dinner Day 2 Checkout at your convenience; tour Aizu at your leisure. Note that the price depends on the season: Price A (4/14/15,1/43/31) Price B (4/16-4/30,5/5-7/31,8/26-10/7,11/13,12/28) Price C (8/1-8/11,8/16-8/25,10/8-11/12,12/29,12/30,1/3) Price D (5/1-5/4,8/12-8/15) Price E (12/31-1/2) Please book the correct price from the menu list.
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Visit Aizu Korori San Kannon &hot spring

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour to Aizu which focuses on the traditional culture of Japanese lacquer. You are given the unusual opportunity to meet craftsmen, and can also see a tree farm from which the raw wood is taken to make lacquer. Visitors can learn all about the backdrop that gave rise to this traditional Japanese culture, and purchase lacquerware pieces while gaining advice from locals. A special guide will accompany you who is well-versed in lacquerware so you can feel at ease during the tour. Schedule: Day 1 13:00 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 13:0016:00 Experience lacquerware, a traditional craft of Aizu; tour a lacquer tree farm and lacquerware workshop 16:00 Arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; check-in to Ekimae Fuji Grand Hotel Day 2 Checkout at your convenience; tour Aizu at your leisure
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Experience Japanese lacquer culture

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour that will take you to Aizu's hot springs and Ouchijuku village. Schedule: Day 1 11:30 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 12:3014:25 Visit Ouchi-juku 14:4015:00 Visit Yunokami Onsen Station (experience the foot bath) 15:1016:00 Visit To-no-Hetsuri 16:20 Arrive at Ashinomaki Onsen, ""Okawaso""; check-in Day 2 10:00 Checkout; take the hotel shuttle bus 10:50 Arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; tour Aizu at your leisure (Nanukamachi, Mt. Iimori, etc.)
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Enjoy Ouchijuku village and hot springs

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour to Aizu's local hot springs and history spots. Schedule: Day 1 11:15 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 11:30 Board the local sightseeing bus with a volunteer guide and visit Tsuruga Castle, Miyaizumi Brewery, a samurai residence, and Mt. Iimori 15:37 Arrive at Higashiyama Onsen Station; take a shuttle bus 15:40 Check-in to the hot springs inn, Harataki; freely relax and enjoy the hot springs baths and dinner Day 2 Checkout at your convenience after breakfast and utilize the local sightseeing bus to take a tour of Aizu at your leisure (Nanukamachi, Mt. Iimori, etc.) Note that prices differ by season: Price A (4/14/15,1/43/31) Price B (4/16-4/30,5/5-7/31,8/26-10/7,11/13,12/28) Price C (8/1-8/11,8/16-8/25,10/8-11/12,12/29,12/30,1/3) Price D (5/1-5/4,8/12-8/15) Price E (12/31-1/2) Please pick the correct price from the menu list. All prices are per person.
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Learn history and enjoy hot springs

strIntroduction: The place you will be visiting is Machida in Tokyo and it is known for its unique mixture of city and countryside. You will meet up at the local tour provider's office that is about a 10-minute walk from the Harajuku Station at 1:00 pm and move to the destination by car. It will be around 1-hour drive from the office to the destination. Once you arrive at Machida, a local host who reside there will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so that hospitable service is ensured for each participant. There will be a translator to help you communicate with the locals. You will spend around 3 to 4 hours exploring the area and doing some activities that locals do in Machida. You will also get the chance to sit down with a local and ask him any questions you may have about their lives. This trip allows you to discover the real life in Japan by connecting with locals and diving into their life. After the tour, you will head back to Harajuku Station to get back to the bustling city life. *Don't forget On this tour, you will explore deep in the woods! So be aware to wear long pants and sleeves that can get dirty!
strTitle: Hike and Explore Japan's Nature Trails near Tokyo

strIntroduction: The tour will start from a vineyard-walking and tasting at its stone-build cellar Sadoya, one of the oldest winery in Japan with. We will move to Shosenkyo Gorge and have traditional noodle Hoto for lunch in Shosenkyo Hoto Building. We will then take a trail of the wild nature in Shousenkyo Gorge, Chichibu Tama National Park. Feel and relax in the tranquility at Erinji Temple which was designed by Zen giant monk Muso Soseki in the 14th century, also well known as a family temple of famous feudal lord Takeda Shingen. 8:00 Meet and pick up at your requested location in Tokyo 10:00 Sadoya winery Sadoya was founded in 1874 and has been operated through generations. Their wines are highly acclaimed, especially the flagship wine Muscut Bailey A Barrel Aged was awarded Silver Medal by Decanter Magazine World Wine Award (UK) 2016. You can walk in the pretty vineyard, go through the stone-build cellar and finally are treated with free tasting! 11:30 Shosenkyo Gorge (lunch) Shosenkyo is said to be the most beautiful gorge in Japan. You can enjoy the wonderful nature every season. Along the trail, you will be astonished to see the odd shape of granite cliffs and a 30 m height waterfall. The highlight is going to be the panoramic view with the Mt. Fuji from the top of the mountain where you can access by the cable car. 14:30 Erinji Temple Erinji Temple was designed by famous Zen monk Muso Soseki, same as Tenryuji Temple in Kyoto and Engakuji Temple in Kamakura. You may enjoy the beautiful view of the Japanese garden. If you are interested in Zazen meditation, you can join one hour session held every 2nd Sunday of the month (*optional). This is also a family temple of Takeda Shingen who was one of the greatest warrior during the warring state in the 16th century. 16:30 Onsen Hot Springs We can have a relaxing time and at an onsen (hot springs) before returning to Tokyo (*optional). 19:30 Drop-off at your requested location in Tokyo
strTitle: Private tour to Sadoya winery, Shosenkyo & Erinji Zen temple

strIntroduction: Gather at Toyama Exit of JR Takadanobaba Station and walk to Shinjuku Sports Centre. Change your cloths to Aikidogi (Aikido uniform) or sports wear and warm-up. Listen to a short lecture of Aikido and learn the concept of it. Learn how to protect yourself, using Aikido techniques, trying to move like people who practice Budo.
strTitle: Try Aikido, a Wonderful Japanese Traditional Martial Art

strIntroduction: This tour is available from April 1st ~ October 31st Learn all there is to know about sake, Japan's beloved alcoholic beverage, on this day tour. Get taken on a journey to some of Nagano Prefectures sake breweries and become familiar with the brewing process and the cultural importance of sake. Your day begins in Yudanaka with a visit to Yamanouchis own sake brewery, Tamamura, a place with over 200 years of history. Learn the basics on how to make the rice wine and get invited into tasting some of the specialty sake. After finishing your drink, you will be led back to Yudanaka Station where lunch and a tasting of local sake at Goen will be waiting for you. With your lunch and first set of sake tasting behind you, the guide will take you on the train to Obuse where two more sake breweries are introduced to you. Obuse is a town famous for its chestnut confectionery and for being the beloved town of Katsushika Hokusai, the ukiyo-e painter best known for his Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji. You will have free time to wander around the old town and buy the chestnut ice cream or confectioneries if youre feeling up for something sweet after all the sake. After stopping by Obuse, make your way to Nagano City where one more tasting of Japans national drink will be waiting for you. At the end of the day, you will be able to call yourself a master of sake tasting. One thing is for sure: you will get your fill of sake on this day tour. Tour itinerary: 11:00 Meet up in front of the Yudanaka Station and leave for the first sake brewery. 12:00 Get back at Yudanaka Station and enjoy a lunch at GOEN. 13:15 Leave for Obuse where two more sake breweries will be visited. 15:00 Enjoy wandering around Obuse in free time after visiting the two Obuse breweries. 15:45 Leave for Nagano City where you will be introduced to the last brewery of the tour. 17:30 End of the tour.
strTitle: Take a One Day Tour to Nagano's Sake Breweries

strIntroduction: This tour is available from May 1st ~ November 15th Obuse is a small town in northern Nagano Prefecture where you can still feel the atmosphere of Japans Edo Period. Obuse is famous as the town where Hokusai Katsushika, the world-famous Japanese artist known for his "Thirty-six Views of Mt Fuji" masterpieces and for various other ukiyo-e paintings, spent the last years of his life. Many of the towns highlights are related to his work and to the work of his patron, Kozan Takai, the man who accommodated Hokusai during his stay in Obuse. The town has developed into a major tourist destination in the region. On this Obuse tour, you will cycle approximately 11.8 miles (19km) from Yudanaka Station, the nearest train station to the Jigokudani Monkey Park, to Obuse. On the way down, you will stop by some cultural spots and go past farmland areas to provide insight into local culture. The entire cycle is about 2.5 hours of downhill or flat paved paths. After reaching the town of Obuse, a lunch made of Obuses specialty, chestnuts, will be served. Lunch is followed by an introduction of the town and some of its major sightseeing attractions, such as the Gansho-in Temple, historic streets, and famous sake breweries. The tour concludes at the Obuse train station, where you can either go back to Yudanaka Station or head for Nagano Station. Tour itinerary: 10:00 Meet/registration at GOEN, the restaurant located in front of Yudanaka Station. 10:15 The cycling tour begins. We will cycle to some historical and cultural sites while enjoying the countryside and natural scenery. We will tell you all you want to know about local culture. 12:45 Arrival at the Gansho-in Temple, the backdoor of Obuse Town. Here you will be shown Hokusai's last masterpiece, a legendary bird drawn on a ceiling as big as 21 tatami mats. 13:30 Head to the central area of the Obuse Town to enjoy a delicious local lunch. 14:45 A brief walking tour will give you an introduction of the town. 15:15 Here you can enjoy free-time at the Obuse town. There are many museums, souvenir shops, sake breweries, cafes, etc. to be explored. 16:25 Gather at the meeting point, then head to the Obuse train station. 16:30 The tour concludes at Obuse station. The train to Yudanaka departs at 16:42 and the train to Nagano departs at 16:54.
strTitle: Join Obuse Cycling & Sightseeing Day Tour, Nagano

strIntroduction: This tour is available from May 1st ~ November 15th. The tour starts at 10am at the Japanese restaurant Goen, found in front of Yudanaka Station. Take a walk through a hillside path where you can absorb the beautiful nature Japan has to offer. After the forest walk you will arrive at Shibu Onsen where you can soak up the history and scenery of the historic hot spring town. The walk continues past the river and some panoramic views and concludes at the Jigokudani Monkey Park. The Jigokudani Monkey Park is famous for its monkeys, as they are the only monkeys known to mankind that bathe in a hot spring. The monkeys don't enter the baths as much during the green season, but they are still lovely to see with their new-born babies. After the monkey park, you head back down the mountain via a different route to a delicious little restaurant for lunch. Tour itinerary: 10:00 Start/registration at GOEN, in front of Yudanaka Station - Head on a forest trail for around 30 minutes to the statue of Heiwa Kannon - Go to Shibu Onsen, learn about its history and stories, and you can challenge yourself to eating an onsen egg. - HIke for 30 minutes towards the Jigokudani Monkey Park while learning about the area and its inhabitants. 12:00 Spend about an hour at the Jigokudani Monkey Park. 13:30 Hike back down a different route. 13:30 Enjoy a delicious lunch at ENZA Cafe. 14:30 Take up the bicycle and start the cycling part! 16:00 Return at Yudanaka Station / / Finish Lunch is followed by a cycle through the Yamanouchi countryside past rice paddies, rivers and fruit orchards. The tour concludes at Yudanaka Station where you can choose to relax your tired feet in a free hot foot bath, relax at the restaurant Goen, or simply head back to Nagano by train.
strTitle: Join Snow Monkey Walking & Cycling Day Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction: This tour is available from Jun 1st ~ Oct 31st. See the famous Japanese Macaques and hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands on this guided day tour. The day starts with the meet-up at Nagano Station. From there, your guide will take you to the entrance of the Jigokudani Monkey Park and lead you to where the monkeys are be roaming around. These monkeys are famous all over the world for their tendency to bathe in the hot springs found at the park. The guide will tell you all of the facts and features that you would want to know about the fuzzy creatures. After some quality time with the snow monkeys, the guide will take you to a restaurant close to the park entrance where you can rest your feet and enjoy a Japanese lunch. After recouping your energy with lunch, the hike to the Shiga-kogen Highlands starts. You will hike 2.8 miles (4.0 km) up the Shiga-kogen Highlands to an altitude of 4900 feet (1500 m). Here, you can see the mountainous area where the snow monkeys and many other of Japanese indigenous animals reside. A knowledgeable guide will walk you through the various flora and fauna to be seen as you walk past the 33 Buddhist Kannon statues that have the function of protecting travelers passing by. The Shiga-kogen Highlands is one of the most famous ski resorts in Japan, and was the setting for the 1998 Winter Olympics. It has more ski slopes than one can count. During the summer, however, the vast highlands are revealed in their green glory. On this hike, you will walk to the tallest waterfall of the Shiga-kogen Highlands and go past several of the famous lakes of the Shiga area. The hike ends near Hasuike lake where you can see one of the biggest ski slopes in the area. From here, the guide will lead you back to Yudanaka Station where you can enjoy the onsen bath located next to the station. The hike to the Monkey Park and Shiga-kogen has impressive sights and scenery, whether it is cloudy or sunny. Be prepared though; the tracks are quite narrow and could be muddy. Good hiking shoes are highly advised! Tour itinerary: 8:45 Gather at the Shinkansen exit of Nagano Station. Our staff will be there by 8:30am. 11:00 Wander around the Jigokudani Monkey Park. 12:15 Have a lunch at the restaurant nearby the Jigokudani Monkey Park entrance. 13:00 Start the hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands. 15:30 Take a break with the backdrop of the tallest waterfall of the Shiga Highlands. 16:15 Arrival at the Biwaike Lake and walk the trail around. 17:00 Arrival at the Hasuike Lake and enjoy the view of a highland's ski resort. Take the bus back to Yudanaka. 17:35 Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 17:50 (or 18:20) and arrives at Nagano at 18:59 (or 19:24).
strTitle: 1-Day Snow Monkey and Shiga-kogen Highlands Hiking Tour

strIntroduction: This is a tour around local places near Mt Fuji! Itinerary: 9:00 a.m. - Depart from Mishima Station If you cannot come to Mishima by Shinkansen, I'll come to pick you up at Tokyo Station by Shinkansen. Please feel free to contact me. NOTE: The Shinkansen ticket fee is *not* included in the tour price. - Oshino Hakkai (60 min) Take pictures with Mt.Fuji. Drink pure and clean water springing from Mt.Fuji. Shopping (you can enjoy a variety of things made in this area, such as vegetable pickles, miso, and fish-paste products) - Unique shopping around Lake Kawaguchi (60 min) Take pictures with Mt.Fuji. Unique Shopping (you can purchase a lot of unique things such as T-shirts and lanterns printed with images of Mt. Fuji) - Lunch (60 min) Enjoy Robata, a way of grilling fresh ingredients in an old traditional restaurant. You can grill and eat vegetables and meats which local people grow and harvest here by yourself. - You can go back to the past. I'll take you to 40-year-old Japanese traditional villages at Lake Saiko. (60 min) If you have any requests or questions, please don't hesitate to ask. I am looking forward to meeting you!  If you are lucky, you can see the beautiful Mt.Fuji. It depends on the weather whether you can see the beautiful Mt. Fuji. But even if you can't see it well, you can enjoy many things in the area. - Return to Mishima station Return from Mishima to Tokyo for one hour by Shinkansen This course will take about 6 hours to get around. Note: Robata-yaki, or simply robata, is a method of grilling fresh ingredients over hot charcoal. It is often called the Japanese barbecue.
strTitle: Experience eating "Robata-yaki" barbecue near Mt. Fuji

strIntroduction: This is a 4.5 hour walking tour in which you can experience local areas in Tokyo. You will see the following highlights: 1. Gokokuji Temple, founded in 1681. Kannon-do and Gekko-do are important cultural properties. 2. The old missionary in Zoushigaya was the house of American missionary 3. Zoushigaya cemetery is one of the three largest cemeteries in Tokyo. 4. Hall dedicated to Kishimojin, famous for being Goddess of easy delivery. 5. Sunshine City in Ikebukuro, which has theme parks, for example: - Namja Town: Indoor type theme park that has 13 attractions with food Pick-up at your hotel, or meet at Gokokuji subway station (Yurakucho line), at 13:00 pm.
strTitle: Walk through the Zoushigaya area to Ikebukuro Sunshine City

strIntroduction: During this tour, you can visit "must see" places in Sapporo. Sapporo is the capital city in Hokkaido and there are a lot of attractions for tourists. I will guide you through most of the famous touristic sites at first. These include Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill, the Odori park, the Clock Tower and more. As for your lunch and dinner I will guide you to famous local restaurants not known to tourists. You can eat Sapporo ramen or "Ghenghis Khan", a local type of mutton BBQ. Then, upon your requests I will take you to a local Izakaya (Japanese style tavern) after dinner in Susukino area. Let's enjoy drinking together (to go to Susukino area after dinner, you don't need to pay extra fee for your guide).
strTitle: Enjoy Sapporo and try Sapporo ramen and mutton BBQ!

strIntroduction: As a main port, Otaru city was developed as an international city. During this tour, you can see Japanese and Western mixed historical buildings at the canal area and Sakaimachi district and you can also visit the famous Herring Palace. You can also enjoy riding a rickshaw and discover the formerly prospering financial area at the so called Otaru wall district Then, you can enjoy some local special snacks including fresh seafood BBQ and Japanese Osenbei rice crackers at Sakaimachi district.
