Besides, you will experience glass bead making as well. I am looking forward to seeing you on this tour!
strTitle: Find historical assets and try fresh seafood in Otaru

strIntroduction: Stroll through Ethnic Town in Tokyo, feeling and seeing real international atmosphere on a 2-hour tour. After gathering at the ticket gate of JR Shin-Okubo Station, you will first walk to Islamic Alley, where you can find Nepali restaurant, shop and see a mosque in a building. Stroll through the biggest and most popular Korean Town in Japan to see so many K-Pop shops, Korean restaurants and souvenir shops, and the so-called "Ikemen-dori" (Handsome Street). Also visit Koizumi Yakumo Memorial Park and go to see Okubo Elementary School, where you can find notices in several languages. Visit one of the biggest Thai supermarket "Asia Superstore" and look for what you want or just relax. Visit Shinjuku Multicultural Plaza in Kabukicho and find how foreign people try to live in Japan. You can find free Japanese classes, and staff will try their best to provide you with any kind of information about Japan. This is the final destination of this tour, and it is possible to take you to Shinjuku Station, taking less than 10 minutes by walk. You can stop and buy whatever you want during this tour.
strTitle: Enjoy a Shin-Okubo Ethnic Town Tour, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tosenkyo, a fan tossing game, started in the Edo period. It is originally from China. Geisha and Maiko in Kyoto played the game back in the days with their customers. The fame can be played from 11 am to 10 pm on Monday to Friday. Or 5 pm to 10 pm on Saturday. Please contact us if about availability. The game will take about 30 minutes. For lunch we will serve Shokado Bento, which is a typical Japanese meal. For dinner we will serve Kaiseki meal, in which you'll enjoy the season's best food in Japan. Both can be served in a vegetarian or Halal version.
strTitle: Play fan tossing game "tousenkyo" and eat Japanese dishes!

strIntroduction: You will start your half-day tour at the JR Saga Arashiyama Station. The Arashiyama district, located west of the Kyoto city center, has long been a scenic leisure spot. Many ancient aristocrats had their villas here a thousand years ago and enjoyed creating literature and poetry. Today, the area is one of the most popular tourist sites in Kyoto. At first you will visit the Togetsukyo Bridge which, as the areas landmark, dates back to the 9th century and provides a good photo opportunity for visitors. It is a very beautiful and traditional bridge. While walking, you will try Yuba soup, rice crackers, fried Yuba cake and Leek pancake. You will then visit the Tenryuji temple which was built in 1339 by the Shogun Ashikaga in memory of the Emperor Go-Daigo and was a complex of more than 100 buildings. They were mostly destroyed by fires and civil wars over the years, but the traditional garden remains in its original form, designed by the monk Muso Soseki. You can enjoy walking in the landscaped garden. From there, you will reach the bamboo grove that is native only to Japan and is a great photo opportunity. Here, you will enjoy walking in the bamboo grove, and then head for the Sagano area which has a historical significance with many beautiful temples. While walking, you will have Japanese sweets as well.
strTitle: Enjoy a Kyoto Food and Drink Tour in Arashiyama

strIntroduction: This is a Japanese cooking class in Kawagoe city, Saitama prefecture (just 30 minutes away from Tokyo). A small tour around Kawagoe will be included! Participants: min: 1 max: 6 For more participants, please ask. Place Community center near Kawagoe Station. I will take you there from the station. Timetable: pick up at the station 9:50 - Meet at Kawagoe Station  go to the kitchen in the community center. In the kitchen: 10:00 - briefing 10:10 - overview of Japanese food 10:20 - cooking - demonstration and hands on cooking 12:00  lunch time in Kuradori street in Kawagoe (Optional tour) 13:00 - Take a stroll through the Kawagoe main street, see old castle, temples and shrines. About Kawagoe Kawagoe is located about 30 minutes by train from Tokyo. The main street Kuradori retains traditional and old buildings from the Edo Period (1603-1867). There are so many historical places around: castles, temples, shrines, old merchant buildings, historical sweets, merchant street and museums.
strTitle: Enjoy a cooking class with a small tour in ancient Kawagoe

strIntroduction: This is a 2.5-hour tour to the old areas of Yanaka and Nippori. Itinerary: Meet outside the North Gate of Nippori Station. Go to a temple and see Buddha. There are many graves around the temples, so we will talk about temples and graves in Japan. Visit museums of traditional architecture. You can understand about Japanese people's lives in the old days. At the museum of public bath, we will see the building and exhibition inside but not bathe. Take a break at a tea house. You can enjoy the atmosphere of a traditional tea house. Try some snacks like rice cracker. Look around some shops: typical crafts, food and green tea. Pass through a traditional shopping mall and go back to the Nippori Station. * Depending on the place you go next, we can guide you to the most convenient place or station.
strTitle: Explore traditional cultures in Yanaka and Nippori, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Rice is a staple food in Japan and the Japanese have been creating a variety of preserved foods in order to enjoy rice, including tsukemono or pickled vegetables, and tsukudani or simmered seafood, vegetables or seaweed in soy sauce. There are hundreds and hundreds of accompaniments for rice in Japan. Karashi-mentaiko is one of them. It is made from tarako or pollack roe, which is immersed in salty water, then seasoned with tougarashi or hot pepper. Spicy salty karashi-mentaiko goes so well with rice that many Japanese choose it as their favorite side dish. Even pasta is combined with this pollack roe delicacy. karashi-mentai spaghetti is one of the popular menus in restaurants and coffee shops. And drinkers enjoy mentaiko without rice when they sip on Japanese sake. Perhaps everybody in Japan loves this seafood product. Fukuoka in Kyushu is the home of karashi-mentaiko. It is said that karashi-mentaiko came from Korea and was adapted to the Japanese taste in Fukuoka. Now mentaiko is produced in many companies of Fukuoka and attains the position of regional food. It is sold everywhere not only in supermarkets, but also in train stations, and airports. Each company makes their own mentaiko, therefore there are a variety of tastes, colors and flavors. In this activity, you can eat five varieties of karashi-mentaiko with rice and miso soup. You are able to compare the tastes and choose your favorite and the host at Suito Fukuoka will give you great tips on how to enjoy mentaiko. It is great to eat this great side dish in its birth place as mentaiko in Fukuoka is fresh and tender. Suito Fukuoka is a place for tourists who want to learn about the traditional food and culture in Kyushu. Discover things you dont know at Suito Fukuoka! The activity is available from Tuesday to Sunday at the following time. Start from 11:00-/ 12:00-/ 13:00 *Please specify your preferred date and time when making reservation.
strTitle: Taste Karashi-Mentaiko in Fukuoka, Kyushu!

strIntroduction: Japanese sake, or rice wine is now gaining popularity all over the world. Sake goes very well with Japanese dishes as well as Chinese, Italian and French foods. A wide variety of sake has been produced in Japan. About 1,600 breweries exist and there are more than 20,000 brands of sake! The taste of sake varies with water, rice, and the climate which is why the location of breweries deeply affect the flavors and aroma of Japanese traditional beverages. For someone new to drinking sake there is the problem that there are too many sake varieties which will lead to confuse about which sake to choose at restaurants or liquor shops. However, Suito Fukuoka offers a great experience for sake tasting and an introduction to Japanese Sake. First of in this activity you will taste five varieties of sake after seeing their labels and you will remember each flavor and aroma. After that you will try blind tasting guess on the variety. Throughout this experience you will get to know which type of tastes you like, dry sake (karakuchi) or sweet sake (amakuchi), and what kind of sake goes well with intensely flavored dishes or lightly salted ones. Fukuoka is well-known for producing good Shochu or distilled spirit (another traditional alcohol in Japan), and there are many brands of sake awarded gold medals in sake competitions. The host at Suito Fukuoka will introduce sake made in Fukuoka and give you great tips on how to enjoy these traditional Japanese alcohols. Learn about the history and techniques for brewing sake! The activity is available from Tuesday to Sunday from the following time. Start from 13:00-/ 14:00-/ 15:00 *Please specify your preferred date and time when making reservation.
strTitle: Enjoy a Blind Tasting of Rice Wine and Sake in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: The Akita region is not a hot spot like the conventional Japanese tourist areas. Yet because of that it gives you a glimpse into the traditional Japanese country life and what 'real' Japan is like! This northern, mountainous region is known for its beautiful landscapes, hot springs, and rich history. The Akita Shore Excursion car tour will allow you to experience all of this while relaxing! The car tour is comfortable and reliable, so all you have to do is sit back and relax! The local guides will teach you about the culture and historical background of the region, so it's no doubt you will come out of this tour well educated on the Akita region! To avoid disappointment, its best to reserve your desired dates as soon as possible! You will visit some of Akita's highlights such as the samurai city Kakunodate, known for its old samurai and merchant residences, as well as with its hundreds of willow cherry blossoms. You will also visit the tranquil legendary Lake Tazawa and hear about its spectacular story. Enjoy this one day tour to Akita's countryside!
strTitle: Shore Excursion from Akita to Kakunodate and Lake Tazawa

strIntroduction: This exciting excursion takes in some of the top sightseeing spots in the Tokushima area. First, visit the summit of Mt Bizan, the symbol of Tokushima City which overlooks the whole area. On clear days you can see as far as Awaji Island and the Kii Peninsula. Afterwards, visit the historic Tokushima Castle Museum, located in a picturesque garden within the ruins of Tokushima Castle. Next, visit Awa Jrobe Yashiki Puppet Theatre at the former residence of a samurai who accepted being executed for a crime he didn't commit to preserve his master's reputation. Next visit Ohnaruto Bridge over the Naruto Strait to view the famous whirlpools, before the tour precedes to Ai no Yakata, a preserved traditional indigo dyeing factory. Try indigo dyeing yourself on any cloth item you have with you! Next, visit Awaodori Kaikan, where visitors can learn about Awa Odori dance and sample local products. Finally, visit Zuiganji Temple with its elegant gardens, carp filled pools, waterfall and delightful red pagoda. All excursions leave from and return to Tokushima Station, city hotels, and Tokushima Awa Odori Airport. Depending on the number of people on this excursion transportation will be by compact, mid-sized or jumbo taxi. Prices include guide and entrance fees where applicable.
strTitle: Shore Excursion in Tokushima and Naruto, Shikoku

strIntroduction: Enjoy some of the wonderful sights and locations of beautiful Shimane prefecture by private taxi. This tour includes a visit to Matsue Castle, known as the Black Castle, one of the last remaining feudal era castles in Japan. Marvel at the picturesque Yuushien Gardens with over 250 varieties of peonies, the delightful Ryuukeidaki waterfalls, the charming pond-side Ichibo Tea House, and three restaurants offering eel, Korean ginseng and other local dishes with seasonal ingredients. The Adachi Art Museum has a fine collection of modern Japanese art, including paintings by Taikan Yokoyama. The museum's garden is widely celebrated for its four seasons displays. Guide and entrance fees for the above are included in the excursion price. But that isn't all, the excursion also includes a visit to Mizuki Shigeru Road, a famous 800 meter shopping area lined with Yokai (monster) statues from the imagination of manga artist Shigeru Mizuki. For more shopping, you will visit the Aeon Mall Hiezu before the excursion ends in Yonago City. This excursion by compact, mid-sized or jumbo taxi departs from either Yonago Kitaro Airport, or Sakaiminato International Passenger (ferry) Terminal and takes approximately 7 hours. Prices include guide and entrance fees where applicable. This tour is available for everyday.
strTitle: Shore Excursion from Sakaiminato Port to Tottori and Matsue!

strIntroduction: At the top of the dining hierarchy in Japan is sushi. Sushi is the most famous Japanese dish outside of Japan and one of the most popular dishes among the Japanese themselves. In Japan, sushi is usually enjoyed on special occasions such as a celebration. However, many Japanese people have not experienced making sushi, instead they just eat sushi at sushi restaurants or buy sushi bento boxes. So this is an offer you can't refuse! A chance to experience making sushi yourself! East Inc. offers you a sushi making workshop in Fukuoka with classes held just 2-minutes walk from Hakata Station on the JR/Subway lines. And dont worry! This class is suitable for complete beginners and there are two courses available with both held over 90 minutes. Course A: Includes making and tasting 3 types of nigirizushi x 2, a delicious tuna roll and a clear broth soup. Course B: Includes making and tasting 8 types of nigirizushi, a delicious tuna roll and a clear broth soup. Reception hours: Tuesday  Sunday 11:30  /13:00  Closed on Monday, and additionally twice a month.
strTitle: Learn How to Make Sushi in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: Painting a Hakata doll is a special experience that you can do in Fukuoka! Hakata dolls are one of the most famous traditional handcrafts in Hakata and have a history of more than 400 years and is known for its rich facial expression and its rich variety. Recently, it has become popular as an interior decoration and as a souvenir for foreign visitors. With this experience, you can express your artistic side and decorate your own Hakata doll to your own tastes by creating an original Hakata doll! It will take 60 minutes to paint one doll and it is open every day from 09:00 to 18:00. You can either make a reservation by yourself or for group of up to 20 people.
strTitle: Enjoy Painting Hakata Dolls in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Wearing a kimono is one of the most popular activities for tourist coming to Japan and can often be done in Kyoto, but now it is also available in Fukuoka prefecture! Traditionally kimono's have many layers, are very heavy and are made from expensive fabric, so many Japanese people don't have a kimono nor do they know how to wear it. So usually for kimono rentals the time wearing it will be very short and you can wont go outside, or at most, only for a short time! As a result, a lot of places offer Yukata experiences instead of Kimono experiences. However, Suito Fukuoka offers unique Kimono experiences where they use an easy to wear kimono called a Wasomi which you can wear just as you would wear western clothes. It's designer is a Kitsuke master, which means she is a master of the procedure and the skills required to wear kimono. She knew how difficult kimonos are to wear and wanted to help Japanese women and their daughters living overseas to be able to put on a kimono by themselves. The wasomi kimono was born after many years of research and trials and even though it is easy to wear, it still looks beautiful and distinctive as a kimono and not a yukata. The time for kitsuke is short, so you will have more time to take photos! *Option detail* 1. 60 minutes option Dress up experience, photoshoot with your own camera. 2. 4 hours option Dress up experience, 4 hours rental. 3. 3 hours option Dress up experience, hair styling, make up and a photoshoot by a professional photographer Note: Only 2 men per group can be accepted due to limited amount of male kimono.
strTitle: Enjoy easy Kimono experience in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: Kushiro Shitsugen National park in Hokkaido opened in 1987 to preserve the diverse ecosystem in the largest wetland in Japan and a habitat for the beautiful White Red-Crested Japanese Crane. It is also well known that it was registered under the Ramsar Convention in 1980 as the first registration within Japan. Since then, Kushiro wetland has been spreading the importance and value of preservation domestically while also receiving a high evaluation from abroad. This exciting car tour is with experienced local driver who will drive to the 3 most popular observation points out of 5. Kushiro Shitsugen is so big that it covers the size of central of Tokyo and there are many ways to enjoy it, making this tour a highly recommend car plan to visit the Kushiro wetland making efficient use of your valuable time. The Kushiro wet tour 4 hours plan is as below: Hosooka viewpoint: It is located on the eastern edge of the park, especially famous for its great sunset view above the winding Kushiro river, marsh and mountain view. Kottaro Marsh Viewpoints: Here there are primeval images of the wetland and also great spots for bird watching and if you are lucky you might be able to see the Japanese crane. Kushiro City Marsh Observatory: The observatory is a great viewpoint overlooking the unique view of tussock. Kushiro City cranes Nature Park The Japanese crane can be seen here all year around.
strTitle: Shore Excursion to Kushiro, a Natural Wonderland in Hokkaido
